poem:
### Diagnosing the Quiet Half

In sterile rooms filled with quiet dread,  
half the story is left unread—  
the man who waits, overlooked by chance,  
in the dance of life, a quiet glance.  
Needles and vials miss his plight,  
yet in the dusk, hope finds its light.  
Half the tale lies unspoken, still—  
the silent partner in love's will.
